question: [File: aptos-core/ecosystem/nft-metadata-crawler/src/utils/gcs.rs] [Function: write_json_to_gcs()] [No checksum verification] Does the upload operation include checksum validation (e.g., MD5, SHA256) to ensure data integrity during transmission, or can network corruption silently corrupt NFT metadata in storage? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/nft-metadata-crawler/src/utils/gcs.rs] [Function: write_image_to_gcs()] [Upload verification missing] After successful upload, is there any verification that the stored file content matches what was sent, or can partial writes or corruption go undetected? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/nft-metadata-crawler/src/utils/gcs.rs] [Function: write_json_to_gcs()] [Filename collision] If two different URIs happen to produce the same SHA256 hash (collision), will the second upload silently overwrite the first without any collision detection or warning? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/nft-metadata-crawler/src/utils/gcs.rs] [Function: write_image_to_gcs()] [Content validation] Is there any validation that the uploaded image buffer actually contains valid image data of the specified format, or can corrupt or malicious data be stored? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/nft-metadata-crawler/src/utils/gcs.rs] [Function: write_json_to_gcs()] [UTF-8 validation] Does the JSON string serialization ensure valid UTF-8 encoding before converting to bytes, or can encoding errors corrupt the stored metadata? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/nft-metadata-crawler/src/utils/gcs.rs] [Function: write_image_to_gcs()] [Image buffer corruption] If the buffer Vec<u8> becomes corrupted in memory before cloning, does this corrupt the uploaded image without detection? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/nft-metadata-crawler/src/utils/gcs.rs] [Function: write_json_to_gcs()] [API quota exhaustion] Can an attacker trigger excessive calls to write_json_to_gcs() to exhaust GCS API quota limits, causing denial of service for legitimate NFT metadata uploads? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/nft-metadata-crawler/src/utils/gcs.rs] [Function: write_image_to_gcs()] [Upload type manipulation] Can the UploadType::Simple configuration be exploited by manipulating Media parameters to trigger different GCS behavior that bypasses security controls? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/nft-metadata-crawler/src/utils/gcs.rs] [Function: write_json_to_gcs()] [Request forgery] Does the UploadObjectRequest properly authenticate with GCS, or can request parameters be manipulated to forge uploads as different GCS identities? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/nft-metadata-crawler/src/utils/gcs.rs] [Function: write_image_to_gcs()] [Multipart upload bypass] By using Simple upload type, are there size limits that could be bypassed using Multipart uploads, and does this create consistency issues? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/nft-metadata-crawler/src/utils/gcs.rs] [Function: write_json_to_gcs()] [Client credential exposure] Is the GCS Client properly secured to prevent credential leakage through error messages, logs, or memory dumps? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/nft-metadata-crawler/src/utils/gcs.rs] [Function: write_json_to_gcs()] [Filename prefix manipulation] Does hardcoding 'cdn/' as filename prefix prevent attackers from writing outside this directory, or can crafted URIs bypass this through hash collision or other means? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/nft-metadata-crawler/src/utils/gcs.rs] [Function: write_image_to_gcs()] [Extension validation bypass] Can attackers exploit the extension handling logic to create files with unexpected extensions that bypass security filters in downstream systems? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/nft-metadata-crawler/src/utils/gcs.rs] [Function: write_json_to_gcs()] [Filename length limit] Does GCS have filename length limits, and can extremely long SHA256 hashes cause upload failures or truncation attacks? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/nft-metadata-crawler/src/utils/gcs.rs] [Function: write_image_to_gcs()] [Multiple extension injection] Can the extension variable contain multiple extensions (e.g., from manipulated ImageFormat), creating security issues like .jpg.php that exploit vulnerable file handlers? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/nft-metadata-crawler/src/utils/gcs.rs] [Function: write_json_to_gcs()] [Reserved filename bypass] Are there checks to prevent creating files with reserved GCS names or special characters that could interfere with bucket operations? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/nft-metadata-crawler/src/utils/gcs.rs] [Function: write_json_to_gcs()] [Content-Type override] Can an attacker manipulate metadata to serve JSON with a different Content-Type header than 'application/json', potentially causing MIME confusion attacks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/nft-metadata-crawler/src/utils/gcs.rs] [Function: write_image_to_gcs()] [Malicious content type] Can the content_type string be injected with additional MIME directives or special characters that exploit vulnerabilities in HTTP clients consuming the GCS URLs? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/nft-metadata-crawler/src/utils/gcs.rs] [Function: write_json_to_gcs()] [Missing charset declaration] Does the application/json content type include proper charset=utf-8 declaration, or can encoding ambiguities cause security issues? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/nft-metadata-crawler/src/utils/gcs.rs] [Function: write_image_to_gcs()] [Content sniffing vulnerability] Do the stored files include X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff protection, or can browsers performing content sniffing misinterpret files and execute malicious content? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/nft-metadata-crawler/src/utils/gcs.rs] [Function: write_json_to_gcs()] [Future cancellation] If the async operation is cancelled mid-upload via .await timeout or task abort, can this leave partial data in GCS causing corruption? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/nft-metadata-crawler/src/utils/gcs.rs] [Function: write_image_to_gcs()] [Async closure safety] Does the boxed() closure properly capture all necessary lifetimes and prevent use-after-free bugs when the closure is executed during retries? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/nft-metadata-crawler/src/utils/gcs.rs] [Function: write_json_to_gcs()] [Panic propagation] If the async closure panics during retry execution, does this properly propagate the panic or does it silently fail leaving the upload incomplete? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/nft-metadata-crawler/src/utils/gcs.rs] [Function: write_image_to_gcs()] [Backoff task poisoning] Can an attacker cause the retry mechanism to enter an infinite loop or deadlock by manipulating timing conditions? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/nft-metadata-crawler/src/utils/gcs.rs] [Function: write_json_to_gcs()] [Metric manipulation] Can attackers manipulate the counter metrics to hide failed uploads or inflate success rates, defeating monitoring and alerting systems? (Medium)
